definition: to sell at auction/to reach a given price at auction
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: The auction house estimates it to be worth as much as HK$60,000.
sentences.chinese: 蘇黎世亞洲預計這枚信封能拍出60，000港元。

sentences.english: One of the key elements in a memorable photograph may well be the quality of light.
sentences.chinese: 要拍出令人過目難忘的照片，關鍵因素之一是光線。

sentences.english: Orange Island officials said the bottles of champagne can be sold for more than 70,000 U. S. dollars of the price.
sentences.chinese: 奧蘭島官員稱每瓶香檳可拍出超過7萬美元的價格。

sentences.english: All underwater photos in this article were taken with point & shoot cameras.
sentences.chinese: 本文所有的水下照片都是用傻瓜機拍出來的。

sentences.english: You cannot take a good photograph unless the object is in focus.
sentences.chinese: 只有對準焦距纔可以拍出好照片。

sentences.english: The photos show the flossy feelings of "Beckham's night ".
sentences.chinese: 寫真拍出了“貝克漢姆之夜”的迷情效果。

sentences.english: This helps viewers understand what they're looking at.
sentences.chinese: 這樣拍出的照片有利於給觀看者判斷拍攝對象的大小。

sentences.english: If they could make beautiful ads, I could bear.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們能拍出漂亮的廣告，我可以忍受。

sentences.english: It's the perfect accessory for getting great photos in any location. Please note, camera not included (duh! ).
sentences.chinese: 想在任何位置拍出好照片，這個附件最適合不過了。

sentences.english: Her face figure looked most distinct took photo from her right front.
sentences.chinese: 從她的右側前方拍出的女神面部輪廓最清晰。

sentences.english: Who would have thought that the person to make a movie about this would be Johnnie To?
sentences.chinese: 誰曾料想，拍出了反映這一現狀影片的人會是杜琪峯？

sentences.english: I guess we felt we had to play the story with truth.
sentences.chinese: 我想需要把故事的真實性拍出來。

sentences.english: All that I needed to make the shot that I had envisioned was for all the necessary elements to align.
sentences.chinese: 要拍出預想中的相片只需將所有必須的要素湊到一起。

sentences.english: If you don't hold that camera still, you'll get a blurred picture.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的相機沒有拿穩，拍出來的照片將會變模糊。

sentences.english: I've been amazing people for at least seven years with what I pull out Canon's compacts.
sentences.chinese: 至少七年來我的佳能小相機拍出的照片一直令人驚歎。

sentences.english: They came out really great and you can’t even tell how miserable I was.
sentences.chinese: 這些拍出來效果很好，你不知道我遭了多少罪。

definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
wide expanse/large area/vast stretch/extending widely/blockbuster movie
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
camera lens/camera shot (in a movie etc)/scene
likeness of a person (sketch, photo, sculpture etc)
to start shooting (a film)/to invest in (a movie)/to put (sth) up for auction
